bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, December 1896

div1.p: Lazear writes that he has introduced Mabel Houston to his friends in Baltimore.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, December 1896
div1.p:
I was glad
to get your note
saying that you had
arrived safely in
N.Y. You were
certainly unlucky in
catching a blizzard
so soon. It did
not strike Baltimore
at all. It has been
a little colder than
usual, but there has
been no bad weather.

I hope it will
soon improve so that
you can get in your
daily walk.

I am much obliged
for the “Times” you
sent. I will send
you the “Sun” often.

Mabel met a
number a new people
at the tea given
her by Mrs. Seymour Waters
We are invited to the Osler's
for supper on Sunday evening.
This afternoon we expect to call
on the Paton's. Aunt Kate and
Frances were here for lunch today
Aunt Kate has entirely recovered.
I intended to write to you
yesterday so you could get
the letter today on your
birthday. I am afraid now
that this will not reach
you until Tomorrow.

May McCallam continues to
improve. Mabel sends her
love.
